Package org.emoncms

Interface Emoncms

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HibernateClient, HttpConnection, MqttClient, RedisClient, SqlClient
    public interface Emoncms
extends java.io.Closeable
    The Emoncms class is used to communicate with an emoncms webserver. The Energy monitoring Content Management System is an open-source web-app for processing, logging and visualising energy, temperature and other environmental data as part of the OpenEnergyMonitor project. An emoncms instance can be used to
    • Post data to inputs and logging feeds.
    • Retrieved stored or processed feed data values.
    • Configure data processing or other settings.
    • Get configuration information.

      Returns the list of all Input objects of the authenticated user and the specified node ID.

      • open

        void open()
   throws EmoncmsUnavailableException
        Open the content management systems' communication connection, such as the initiation of thread pools or verifications of configured parameters.
        Throws:
        EmoncmsUnavailableException - if the configured parameters cannot describe a communication

      • post

        void post​(java.lang.String node,
          java.lang.String name,
          Timevalue timevalue)
   throws EmoncmsException
        Post a Timevalue to a defined Input, identified by its node and name.

        If the timevalues timestamp equals null, the CMS will use the current timestamp, to further process the input.

        Parameters:
        node - the Node ID of the input, a timevalue should be posted to.
        name - the Name of the input, a timevalue should be posted to.
        timevalue - the timevalue to post.
        Throws:
        EmoncmsException - if the communication with the emoncms server fails.

      • post

        void post​(java.lang.String node,
          java.lang.Long time,
          java.util.List<Namevalue> namevalues)
   throws EmoncmsException
        Post a list of Namevalues to a defined Input, identified by their node.

        If the time equals null, the CMS will use the current timestamp, to further process the inputs.

        Parameters:
        node - the common Node ID of the inputs, a value should be posted to.
        time - the timestamp, the posted values should be processed with.
        namevalues - the list of namevalues that will be posted.
        Throws:
        EmoncmsException - if the communication with the emoncms server fails.

      • post

        void post​(DataList data)
   throws EmoncmsException
        Post data to a set of Inputs.
        Parameters:
        data - the data to post to the CMS.
        Throws:
        EmoncmsException - if the communication with the emoncms server fails.

      • getInputList

        default java.util.List<Input> getInputList​(java.lang.String node)
                                    throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException,
                                           EmoncmsException
        Returns the list of all Input objects of the authenticated user and the specified node ID. An input allows to configure processes and post data through e.g. Input.post(Timevalue).
        Parameters:
        node - the Node ID, inputs should be returned for.
        Returns:
        the list of inputs.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the connection type does not allow the operation.
        EmoncmsException - if the communication with the emoncms server fails.

        default Input getInput​(java.lang.String node,
                       java.lang.String name)
                throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException,

        Parameters:
        node - the Node ID of the input to get.
        name - the Name of the input to get.
        Returns:
        the input object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the connection type does not allow the operation.
        EmoncmsException - if the communication with the emoncms server fails.

      • getFeedList

        default java.util.List<Feed> getFeedList()
                                  throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException,
                                         EmoncmsException
        Returns the list of all Feed objects of the authenticated user. A feed allows to retrieve the latest data and configuration fields, as well as historical data through e.g. Feed.getData(long, long, int).
        Returns:
        the list of feeds.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the connection type does not allow the operation.
        EmoncmsException - if the communication with the emoncms server fails.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the feed object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the connection type does not allow the operation.
        EmoncmsException - if the communication with the emoncms server fails.

      • getFeedValues

        default java.util.Map<Feed,​java.lang.Double> getFeedValues​(java.util.List<Feed> feeds)
                                                          throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException,
                                                                 EmoncmsException
        Returns the latest values of a list of Feed objects.
        Parameters:
        feeds - the list of feeds to get the latest values for.
        Returns:
        a map of corresponding feed values.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the connection type does not allow the operation.
        EmoncmsException - if the communication with the emoncms server fails.

      • newFeed

        default int newFeed​(java.lang.String name,
                    java.lang.String tag,
                    Datatype type,
                    Engine engine,
                    Options options)
             throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException,
                    EmoncmsException
        Creates a new Feed for the emoncms server. A feed allows to retrieve the latest data and configuration fields, as well as historical data through e.g. Feed.getData(long, long, int).
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the feed to create.
        tag - an optional descriptor that will be used to group feeds in the emoncms web view. The tag may be left null.
        type - the Datatype of the feed.
        engine - the Engine of the feed.
        options - the options of the feed engine. Depending of the engine, this may be left null.
        Returns:
        the ID of the newly created feed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the connection type does not allow the operation.
        EmoncmsException - if the communication with the emoncms server fails.
